channel.title: Posts on smirking teapot
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on smirking teapot

item.title: Filling the Gaps With Visitor Pattern
item.description: Design patterns can be confusing. Sometimes the implementations are similar, other times the line between their intent becomes unclear. I try to make sense of some of the closely related Object-Oriented Behavioural Patterns in this post by attempting to define a Visitor and compare it with other patterns – Strategy, Command and Type Erasure Idiom in C++(not same as void* in C or Type Erasure in Java).

item.title: Analysis of algorithms beyond the worst case
item.description: The worst-case analysis gives a theoretical upper bound on the algorithmic performance. It’s important but, it has its limitations. So, there are other kinds of analyses to fill those gaps.

item.title: Negative Integers are NOT Literals
item.description: TL;DR: Write your negative numbers in base-10 and, wrap them in parentheses. An unusual behaviour There are, generally, two ways to represent a negative integer literal:
